Key Arguments: Censorship of opinions is dangerous and can lead to suppression of truth.
Government often fails to provide truthful answers and misleads the public.
Historical examples, such as Nazi book burnings, show the dangers of suppressing dissenting views.
The official narrative around COVID-19 vaccines has been misleading, with significant adverse effects being downplayed.
Qualified opinions and accurate information have been wrongly suppressed.
Government cannot be trusted to decide what is truth due to potential for corruption and dishonesty.
Main Themes: Historical examples of suppression of truth
Notable Quotes: Withholding the truth is as good as lying.
Truth, no matter how unpalatable, is truth!
Suppressing the truth is as good as lying.
Censorship is a very dangerous power in the wrong hands. AUSTRALIANS CANNOT AFFORD THAT RISK!
